abstract: Bangkok's flood defenses continue to fall as floodwaters press further into the city; Prime Min Yingluck Shinawatra declares a five-day holiday that will shut down much of the city's businesses to allow residents to cope with encroaching waters.
snippet: Unusually heavy flooding and typhoons have killed 800 people and affected more than eight million in an arc that stretches across Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam and the Philippines.
lead_paragraph: Unusually heavy flooding and typhoons have killed 800 people and affected more than eight million in an arc that stretches across Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam and the Philippines.

headline.main: Flood Defenses Are Overrun in Bangkok
headline.print_headline: Flood Defenses Are Overrun in Bangkok
